summary: In this context, adenosine triphosphate (ATP) and latrunculin B are related through the investigation of ATP release mechanisms during T cell activation. Latrunculin B, an actin polymerization inhibitor, significantly reduced ATP release from stimulated cells, indicating that actin dynamics play a crucial role in ATP release and mitochondrial translocation during immune responses. The findings suggest that ATP release is linked to mitochondrial activity, which is influenced by the cytoskeletal structure affected by latrunculin B.
